assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes CPSV-AP in their national catalogue with the National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The CPSV-AP allows describing public services in a standardised human and machine-readable format. This fact fosters the discoverability of the datasets containing information about public services. Therefore, it enhances its reuse and visibility.

CPSV-AP Joinup webpage:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile/release/22


Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

On using the core public sector vocabulary (CPSV) to publish a "citizen's guide" as linked data:
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/325495548_On_using_the_core_public_sector_vocabulary_CPSV_to_publish_a_citizen's_guide_as_linked_data

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) has established Working Groups. These Working Groups are open to the participation of everyone interested in semantic solution working for public administrations in the Member States or in EU institutions.

SEMIC working groups:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/about

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) develops solutions to help European public administrations perform seamless and meaningful cross-border and cross-domain data exchanges. They develop semantic specifications and interoperability solutions under the ISA² Programme. When a new solution release is finished, it is submitted for a public review with a minimum period of four weeks.

Specification development process by the ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/document/description-change-management-release-and-publication-process-structural-metadata-specifications

Detailed document ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/document/2016-10/description_of_a_change_management_release_and_publication_process_for_structural_metadata_specifications_developed_by_the_isa_progr.pdf

criterion_description: The specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile is publicly available for its use and implementation. Moreover, it is available for everyone to study with no cost on Joinup webpage.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
All solutions developed in ISA² Programme are under ISA Open Metadata Licence which is perpetual, royalty-free and non-exclusive license to Use and re-Use the Works.

ISA open metadata license:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/licence/isa-open-metadata-licence-v11

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was developed in 2014 by Catalogue of Services actions, and it has been evolved taking into account the inputs of the different stakeholders involved according to the development process stated by SEMIC. It is supporting several initiatives at European level, this fact demonstrates the maturity for its use in the development of products and services.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
This Core Vocabulary was developed in 2014 and has good acceptance in the European Union. The CPSV-AP is already being used by public administrations in Belgium, Italy, Finland and Estonia to create a cross-border federated catalogue of public services. Moreover, it is the basis of the European Catalogue of Services 

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

CPSV-AP used in EU:
https://www.ceps.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/NO0119341ENN.en_.pdf

Catalogue of Services:
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/catalogue-services-helping-eu-countries-catalogue-and-describe-public-services_en

SEMIC in Joinup:

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
CPSV-AP is a reusable and extensible data model for harmonising the way public services are described in a machine-readable format. So it describes the public administrations and eases their visualization and comprehensibility.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

CPSV-AP is independent of any software, hardware, or operating system. So it can be said that the specification is independent of any specific technology or platform.

criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The adoption of this Core Vocabulary as a data model does not hamper the scalability of systems.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The purpose of this Core Vocabulary is to harmonise public services (information) stored in different local, regional and national information sources, allowing the information to be searched and shared easily within and across public administrations all over Europe.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. This Core Vocabulary fosters interoperability between public administrations, cross border services and impacts positively the development of eGovernment.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
The purpose of this Core Vocabulary is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The purpose of this Core Vocabulary is not related to security and privacy of the data exchange. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The purpose of CPSV-AP is related to the delivery of multilingual public services. All datatype properties with datatype “text” where the value for that property may exist in multiple languages, the property has multiple instances which are tagged with a language identifier for each language in which the value for that property exists.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The purpose of the specification is to facilitate the exchange of structured data. By allowing to make the data available to other persons or organisations, this Core Vocabulary reduces the administrative burden.

CPSV-AP reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The purpose of this Core Vocabulary is not related to long term preservation of electronic records. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are not explicit studies or documentation regarding the effectiveness or efficiency of the Core Vocabulary Application Profile. However, an article on the usefulness of the AP for the publication of linked data from administrations. 

Study about ISA2 efficiency:
https://www.ceps.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/NO0119341ENN.en_.pdf

On using the core public sector vocabulary (CPSV) to publish a "citizen's guide" as linked data:
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/325495548_On_using_the_core_public_sector_vocabulary_CPSV_to_publish_a_citizen's_guide_as_linked_data

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile 2.2 is already associated to an EIRA ABB in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, this Core Vocabulary can define the interoperability aspects of the "Core Data Model" and "Data" ABBs from the EIRA Semantic view.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
As a vocabulary, the implementation of CPSV-AP can be tested using methods like SHACL shapes and using semantic reasoners to ensure that the implementation is well-formed. These validation mechanisms can be used with open source tools or lite versions of tools like GrapghDB or Protégé.

SHACL validation: 
https://graphdb.ontotext.com/documentation/free/shacl-validation.html#what-is-shacl-validation

Semantic Reasoners List: 
http://owl.cs.manchester.ac.uk/tools/list-of-reasoners/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
Belgium is recommending CPSV-AP in their ICT National Catalogues.

Belgium national catalogue:
https://www.belgif.be/nl/specifications

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
The CPSV-AP allows describing public services in a standarised human and machine-readable format. This fact fosters the discoverability of the datasets containing the information of public services. Therefore, it enhances its reuse and visibility. That is the reason why CPSV-AP is implementing the EU Catalogue of Services. Moreover, it is recommended in the CarTool 3.1.0 as one of the Operational enablers for the Catalogue of Services Solution Architecture Template (SAT).

CPSV-AP Joinup webpage:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/core-public-service-vocabulary-application-profile/release/22

Catalogue of Services news page: 
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/catalogue-services-helping-eu-countries-catalogue-and-describe-public-services_en

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 1 Member States' catalogue of recommended specifications. The Member State that includes this Core Vocabulary on their catalogue is Belgium.

Belgium national catalogue:
https://www.belgif.be/nl/specifications

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of CPSV-AP within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

assessment_title: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
This Core Vocabulary Application Profile offers the possibility of describing public services in a standarised way easing their reuse and discoverability. It can be translated  into Federated Catalogues of Public Services that can be accessed across-borders. As the "Evaluation Study supporting the interim evaluation of the programme on interoperability solutions for European public administrations, businesses and citizens (ISA²)" states, there are several MS like Italy or Finland that are using CPSV-AP to create Public Services Catalogues.

JoinUp Webpage:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/

Evaluation Study supporting the interim evaluation of the programme on interoperability solutions for European public administrations, businesses and citizens (ISA²): 
https://www.ceps.eu/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/NO0119341ENN.en_.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Core Public Service Vocabulary Application Profile (CPSV-AP) v2.2
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en
